text.section: The Alcoholic Beverages Board of St. Mary's County may issue a special wine festival (WF) license.

Notwithstanding any other provision to the contrary, an applicant for a special WF license shall be a holder of an existing retail alcoholic beverages license issued in the State authorizing the sale of wine, a State Class 3 winery license, or a State Class 4 winery license issued under this article.

A holder of a special WF license shall only display and sell wine:
That is:
Manufactured and processed in any state;
Price filed in accordance with regulations adopted by the Comptroller; and
Distributed in the State at the time the application is filed;
At retail for consumption on or off the licensed premises on the days and for the hours designated for the festival; and
That is manufactured and processed in any state at retail for consumption off the licensed premises on the days and hours designated for the festival.
This section does not prohibit the holder of a special WF license from holding another alcoholic beverages license of a different class or nature.

The Alcoholic Beverages Board of St. Mary's County:
Shall approve one weekend annually for the wine festival;
Shall approve a location in St. Mary's County for this festival that is not licensed under this article; and
Shall ensure that the primary focus of the festival is the promotion of Maryland wine.
The Alcoholic Beverages Board of St. Mary's County shall adopt regulations for carrying out this section.
